title: Evaluating multimodal AI in medical diagnostics
details: R Kaczmarczyk, TI Wilhelm, R Martin, J Roos - npj Digital Medicine, 2024
abstract: This study evaluates multimodal AI models' accuracy and responsiveness in answering NEJM Image Challenge questions, juxtaposed with human collective intelligence, underscoring AI's potential and current limitations in clinical diagnostics …

title: A deep learning-based melanocytic nevi classification algorithm by leveraging physiologic-inspired knowledge and channel encoded information
details: Q Sun, Y Tang, S Wang, J Chen, H Xu, Y Ling - IEEE Access, 2024
abstract: Melanocytic nevi (MN), which are the most prevalent benign skin tumors, can be classified into three subtypes based on the depth of the nevus cell nests: junctional, compound, and intradermal nevi. Among these subtypes, intradermal nevi pose a …

title: GPT-4o and the Quest for Machine Learning Interpretability in ICU Mortality Prediction
details: ME Samadi, K Nikulina, SJ Fritsch, A Schuppert - 2024
abstract: Background Clinical utilization of machine learning is hampered by the lack of interpretability inherent in most non-linear black box modeling approaches, reducing trust among clinicians and regulators. Advanced large language models, such as …
